page.title: 01Kidderminster, Physical
page.content: The area, which is situated to the SSW of the carpet manufacturing town of{ Kidderminster, is divided into three approximately equal zones: dry heathland, residential and industrial. The western part is substantially dry heathland with some agriculture and is bordered on the northern side by the West Midland Safari Park and crossed by the Severn Valley Railway. The industrial areas are largely in the SE and are mostly contained within three distinct trading/industrial estates. Running almost parallel to each other are the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal, which once carried pottery form Staffordshire to the South and the Stour, a minor tributary of the River Severn. In the extreme SE corner is the Summerfield Research Station which does rocket development work and occupies 1 sq.km.
